intro: Cassine xylocarpa var. attenuata, commonly known as the narrowleaf cassine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and Malaysia, and thrives in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It often grows in lowland forests and along riverbanks, preferring moist, well-drained soils. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds.
